intro: Cinnamomum reichenbachii, commonly known as the Chinese cinnamon or Cinnamomum cassia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to southern China, Vietnam, and other parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic bark, which is used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aroma. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and produces small yellowish-green flowers followed by dark purple berries.
